contentrichtext.text: {{for|the Turkish drink|Ayran}} {{Expand French|date=December 2008|Airan}} {{Infobox French commune |name = Airan |image = Chateau Coupigny.JPG |caption = Chateau of Coupigny |region = Basse-Normandie |department = Calvados |arrondissement = Caen |canton = BouguÃ©bus |INSEE = 14005 |postal code = 14370 |mayor = Patrice Martin |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = |longitude = -0.1506 |latitude = 49.1019 |elevation m = 30 |elevation min m = 22 |elevation max m = 64 |area km2 = 13.5 |population = 620 |population date = 2008 }} '''Airan''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Calvados]] [[Departments of France|department]] in the [[Basse-Normandie]] [[Regions of France|region]] in northwestern [[France]]. ==Monuments== A tower ruins is located in a hamlet close to Airan. An old legend says that a secret way connects this tower to the church of Airan, and that the gold bell of this church is hidden in this passage.
